IncidentAddress.IncAddrComment: S SALISBURY BLVD/ E MARKET ST

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Patrol Vehicle E-15 is equipped with an in car camera. Dash Camera:https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=080ad595d8f24ba78de4c1f62502bf09partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 Body Worn Camera:https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=c31481f62406487298580e74bd298102partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 Crime: Driving Under the Influence Weather: Clear and 50 degrees Defendant: Shekinah Nicole Fooks Date of Birth: 9/8/2000 Date of Arrest: 3/25/2023 Time of Arrest: 0214 hours License#: F-200-765-630-699 DUI #: 23-54-057 DUI Citation #: 2HF0URM Subsequent Offender: No Accident Involved: No CERTIFICATES AND TRAINING: * I am trained to administer standardized field sobriety tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. *I have successfully completed the Advanced Roadside Impairment Driving Enforcement course through the Maryland State Police. NARRATIVE: Phase #1 - Vehicle In Motion: On 3/25/23 at approximately 0202 hours, I TFC Eckrich was on routine patrol in the area of U.S Rt 13 and South Blvd. At that time I observed a white Volkswagon bearing Maryland registration 6FG2024 traveling on U.S Rt 13 in front of me. The vehicle appeared to be traveling above the posted speed limit. I activated my Kustom Eagle II radar and obtained a speed of 45 mph in a posted 35 mph zone. I also observed the vehicle failing to maintain its lane by swerving into lane 1 twice with its right side tires. The vehicle then approached the S-Bend near Newton St. I observed the vehicle swerve from lane 1 to lane 2 causing its right side tires to go over the white dotted line. I activated my emergency equipment and initiated a traffic stop in the area of U.S Rt 13 and Market St. Phase #2 - Personal Contact I exited my patrol vehicle and made contact with the driver who was identified by her Maryland drivers license as SHEkinAH NICOLE FOOKS (B/F 9/8/00). I observed Fooks eyes to be bloodshot and glassy. While speaking with Fooks I detected the strong odor of alcoholic beverage coming from within the vehicle. I returned to my patrol vehicle and provided MSP Salisbury with Fooks information. Phase #3 - Pre Arrest Screening I returned to Fooks vehicle and asked her to step out of the vehicle. I advised Fooks I could detect the odor of alcoholic beverage coming from the vehicle and asked how much she had to drink tonight. Fooks stated she just had one drink. While speaking with Fooks outside of the vehicle, I again detected the strong odor of alcoholic beverage but this time it was coming from Fookss breath and person. Based on my observations, I advised Fooks I would be conducting standardized field sobriety tests. Fooks voluntarily agreed to perform Standardized Field Sobriety I asked Fooks a standard series of questions for pre-screening prior to performing the Standardized Field Sobriety test. Visual check of inside of Fooks mouth: Had a cough drop in her mouth. Fooks also wears braces Any physical or medical disabilities: No Do you wear contacts or glasses: wears glasses Any medication: No Recreational drugs: No Any injuries or disabilities: No Fooks then voluntarily agreed to submit to the Standardized Field Sobriety Tests and I began with the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Test. Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus I explained the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test to Fooks and asked her if she understood the test. Fooks stated that she understood the test and I began. Resting Nystagmus: No Equal Tracking: Yes Equal Pupil Size: Yes Lack of smooth pursuit in both eyes Distinct and sustained Nystagmus at maximum deviation in both eyes Onset of nystagmus prior to 45 degrees present in both eyes. Vertical Nystagmus: Yes Total Horizontal Gaze NystagmusClues:6 out of 6 Walk and Turn Weather: Clear Surface: Level surface, clear of any debris. Fooks removed her shoes for the test I instructed Fooks into the instructional phase. my demonstration of the test Fooks could not maintain her balance and broke heel to toe. I asked Fooks if she understood the test and she stated that she understood the instructions. Instructional Phase: -Cannot maintain balance Walking stage 1st 9: -Missed heel to toe on step 7 Turn: Incorrect: turned around in one motion instead of taking a series of small steps as instructed Walking stage 2nd 9: -Incorrect number of steps:10 Total Walk and Turn Clues: 4 of 8 One Leg Stand I next explained and demonstrated the One Leg Stand test to Fooks. I asked Fooks if she understood the test and she stated she did.Fooks picked up her right foot for the test. Seconds 1-10: Swayed from side to side Seconds 11-20: Swayed from side to side Seconds 21-30: Swayed from side to side Total One Leg Stand Clues:1 of 4 Preliminary Breath Test Fooks was offered the preliminary breath test. Fooks agreed to submit to the preliminary breath test and gave a result of .18 BRAC Arrest and Transport Based on the following, I had reason to believe Fooks was driving a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol: * Eyes unusually glassy. * Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage coming from inside of the vehicle. * Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage coming from her breath and person. * My observed signs of impairment as she performed standard field sobriety tests. * Admitted to drinking alcoholic beverage. I placed Fooks under arrest for driving under the influence of alcohol at 0214 hours. I placed Fooks into the front passenger seat of my patrol vehicle. I then entered my patrol vehicle at which time I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage that was not present in my vehicle prior to placing Fooks into my vehicle. 20 Minute Observation Period: I transported Fooks to the Maryland State Police Salisbury barrack for processing. I read the MVA DR-15 advice of rights in English to Fooks.Fooks stated she would submit to the intoximeter test and signed the DR-15 at 0238 hours.Sgt Pardoe, a certified intoximeter operator administered the test at 0247 hours. Fookss breath specimen was found to contain an alcohol concentration of .13 grams of alcohol per 210 liters of breath. Fooks was given all copies of pertinent paperwork and was released to a sober adult. Fooks was polite and was cooperative throughout this encounter. It should be noted that Fooks appeared to take this situation very seriously. All events did occur in Wicomico County, Maryland.
